data.title: Whoopi Goldberg to return to Disney as Sister Mary Clarence with Sister Act 3
data.meta_description: After almost three decades Whoopi Goldberg will reprise her role as Sister Mary Clarence in Sister Act 3.
data.text:
Oh Happy Day!

After almost three decades Whoopi Goldberg will reprise her role as Sister Mary Clarence in Sister Act 3.

The Oscar-winning actor will also produce the film alongside Tyler Perry after it was confirmed by Disney Studios Motion Picture Production boss Sean Bailey.

The movie is already in development and will be released on DisneyPlus.

Goldberg debuted in 1992 as Deloris Van Cartier, a singer in an adult club, who viewers came to know as Sister Mary Clarence — the singing nun.

The film was a box office success and became one of the top 10 grossing films that year.

The sequel Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit was released the following year and also starred Goldberg and Maggie Smith — who returned as the Reverend Mother.

The film marks the fourth collaboration between Perry and Goldberg who most recently worked on 2018’s Nobody’s Fool.

In 2018 it was revealed that Karin Gist who was executive producer of Revenge, Grey’s Anatomy and One Tree Hill and State of Georgia producer Regina Hicks were working on a script for a new Sister Act.

The films are also renowned for their soundtracks with songs like Rescue Me, My Guy, Ain’t No Mountain High Enough and Oh Happy Day featuring on the first two.

The new film comes as Disney announced a massive list of new movies and TV shows to ruffle their competitors feathers.

Chief executive at Disney Bob Chapek revealed the company would be unleashing 63 series and 42 films, many of which would be heading to its flagship streaming service Disney + including 10 new Star Wars projects, several Marvel spin-offs, remakes of classic films and much-awaited sequels.

Disney+ launched just over a year ago and the streaming service has already amassed 86.8 million subscribers around the globe, picking up 12 million of those in just the past month.
